name: Fabienne's Leeks and Monkfish
author: Fabienne Riesen
summary: Monkfish has become my favorite fish. Its delicate flavor is complemented by the combination of leeks and carefully chosen spices. The amount of curry could be modified to your own taste. This dish could be served over rice, with mashed potatoes, or with fingerling potatoes.
ingredients: 2 cups chopped leeks, white and light green parts only
¾ teaspoon hot Madras curry powder, or to taste
1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste
salt and ground black pepper to taste
1 pound monkfish fillets, cut into cubes
directions: Heat olive oil in a stock pot over medium heat
Stir in leeks, white wine, lemon juice, cumin, Madras curry powder, turmeric, paprika, coriander, ginger, cayenne, salt, and pepper
Cover pot and reduce heat to medium-low, stirring frequently until all liquid is absorbed, about 30 minutes
Uncover pot, stir in coconut milk, and reduce heat to low; simmer uncovered for 30 minutes
Place monkfish gently into pot; spoon leek mixture over monkfish
Cook and stir gently over low heat until fish flakes easily with a fork, about 5 minutes
